meanings.definition: A person who believes in the superiority or uniqueness of a particular group or nation.
meanings.sent1: The exceptionalists in our history class always talk about how our country is the best.
meanings.sent2: The exceptionalists at the meeting argued that their team deserved special treatment.
meanings.sent3: The exceptionalists in the debate club think their ideas are always the most brilliant.
meanings.sent4: She stood out among the students like an exceptionalist in a sea of mediocrity.
meanings.sent5: The exceptionalists proudly waved their flag, showing their unwavering loyalty.

meanings.definition: Those who advocate for exceptionalism in a specific context.
meanings.sent1: As exceptionalists of environmental conservation, they pushed for stricter regulations.
meanings.sent2: The exceptionalists of the art world believed in promoting unique and innovative works.
meanings.sent3: The exceptionalists of fashion design always strive to push boundaries with their creations.
meanings.sent4: She approached her work with the precision of an exceptionalist crafting a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The exceptionalists of the culinary world aimed to redefine gourmet dining experiences.
